name: Airbus A319
description: A shortened-fuselage member of the Airbus A320 family, designed for short-to-medium-range flights.

name: Airbus A320
description: The foundational model of the A320 family and one of the world's most popular narrow-body airliners.

name: Airbus A321
description: The largest variant of the A320 family, featuring a stretched fuselage for higher passenger capacity.

name: Airbus A380
description: The world's largest passenger airliner, a double-deck, wide-body aircraft designed for long-haul travel.

name: Airseeker R.1 (RC-135W)
crew: 2 Pilots, 1 Navigator, up to 25 Mission Crew
description: A signals intelligence aircraft providing near-real-time on-scene intelligence collection and analysis.

name: BAe Hawk
description: A British single-engine, jet-powered advanced trainer aircraft also capable of light-attack roles.

name: Beechcraft Super King Air
description: A twin-turboprop utility aircraft used widely for corporate transport and light cargo missions.

name: V-22 Osprey
description: A tiltrotor aircraft with both vertical takeoff (VTOL) and high-speed turboprop cruise capabilities.

name: Boeing 747-8F
description: The largest commercial cargo aircraft produced by Boeing, featuring a iconic nose-loading door.

name: Boeing 767-300
description: A wide-body, twin-engine jet airliner designed for medium to long-haul trans-continental routes.

name: AH-64D Apache
weapons: 30mm M230 Chain Gun, AGM-114 Hellfire, Hydra 70 Rockets
description: An advanced multi-role attack helicopter featuring the Longbow fire-control radar.

name: Boeing E-7 Wedgetail
description: Based on the 737-700, this aircraft provides airborne early warning and control using an active electronically scanned array radar.

name: C-130J Super Hercules
description: The latest variant of the Hercules, featuring updated engines and a digital flight deck for tactical airlift.

name: C-17 Globemaster III
description: A large military transport aircraft capable of strategic delivery of troops and heavy cargo directly to austere airfields.

name: CH-47 Chinook
weapons: 2 x M134 Miniguns, 1 x M60 Machine Gun
description: A heavy-lift tandem rotor helicopter used for troop movement, artillery placement, and battlefield resupply.

name: Airbus H135 (EC135)
description: A twin-engine light utility helicopter widely used by emergency services and for flight training.

name: F-15 Eagle
weapons: 20mm M61 Vulcan, AIM-120 AMRAAM, AIM-9 Sidewinder
description: An all-weather, extremely maneuverable tactical fighter designed to gain and maintain air supremacy.

name: F-16 Fighting Falcon
weapons: 20mm M61 Vulcan, AIM-120, Various Air-to-Ground Munitions
description: A compact, multi-role fighter aircraft capable of both air-to-air and air-to-surface combat.

name: F-22 Raptor
weapons: 20mm M61A2, 6 x AIM-120 AMRAAM, 2 x AIM-9 Sidewinder
description: A fifth-generation stealth air superiority fighter incorporating supercruise and thrust vectoring.

name: F-35 Lightning II
description: A multi-role stealth fighter optimized for ground attack and air-to-air missions.

name: Grob G 115 Tutor
description: A light aircraft made of composite materials, used primarily by the RAF for elementary flying training.

name: F/A-18 Hornet
description: A versatile multi-role combat jet designed for both carrier-based and land-based operations.

name: McDonnell Douglas DC-3
description: A fixed-wing propeller-driven airliner that revolutionized air transport in the 1930s and 1940s.

name: Protector RG1
description: The UK's next-generation Medium Altitude Long Endurance (MALE) Remotely Piloted Aircraft System (RPAS).

name: Saab JAS 39 Gripen
description: A lightweight single-engine multirole fighter aircraft manufactured by the Swedish aerospace company Saab.

name: Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk
description: The primary utility helicopter for the US Army, used for air assault, medevac, and transport.

name: Eurofighter Typhoon
description: A highly agile twin-engine multirole fighter designed for air superiority and ground attack.

name: Voyager (A330 MRTT)
description: A multi-role tanker transport based on the Airbus A330, used by the RAF for aerial refueling and transport.

name: A400M Atlas
description: A multi-national four-engine turboprop military transport aircraft designed as a strategic-tactical airlifter.
